snippet.textDisplay:
+Juriel Primary Agreed, this game was more lighthearted in the story and plot and pretty short compared to other big titles at that moment such as FF VII or VIII, Chrono Cross, etc. Heck, it's even shorter than Brave Fencer Musashi (around 10 hours to finish the story). It is enjoyable as it wasn't too demanding : I didn't need to spend many hours to grind since it's leveling system is so unique that you will be able to face any boss as long as you don't run away from enemies (I mean literally run, this is a hack and slash action platformer RPG), similar to Chrono Trigger. There's also not many secrets I need to unravel A.K.A. easy to complete 100%. But it still gave me a hearty challenge and difficulty. And especially, the environment and musics are so good and let's you immerse yourself into it's world.

There are a fan-made sequel to this game where you play as Mint and her sister in 2 player mode, but unfortunately, it's Japanese only.
snippet.textOriginal:
+Juriel Primary Agreed, this game was more lighthearted in the story and plot and pretty short compared to other big titles at that moment such as FF VII or VIII, Chrono Cross, etc. Heck, it's even shorter than Brave Fencer Musashi (around 10 hours to finish the story). It is enjoyable as it wasn't too demanding : I didn't need to spend many hours to grind since it's leveling system is so unique that you will be able to face any boss as long as you don't run away from enemies (I mean literally run, this is a hack and slash action platformer RPG), similar to Chrono Trigger. There's also not many secrets I need to unravel A.K.A. easy to complete 100%. But it still gave me a hearty challenge and difficulty. And especially, the environment and musics are so good and let's you immerse yourself into it's world.

There are a fan-made sequel to this game where you play as Mint and her sister in 2 player mode, but unfortunately, it's Japanese only.

snippet.textDisplay: @Nunya Bizniz Its a very good game, though there are no vocals. But there are lots of conversations, and you can choose between two characters that has different yet crossed stories. You can choose between a spoiled "EX"-princess who was kicked out due to her being a slacker, or a doll that has lost his purpose but found it thanks to a nice lady. The story of both are good, but it needs a sequel.
snippet.textOriginal: @Nunya Bizniz Its a very good game, though there are no vocals. But there are lots of conversations, and you can choose between two characters that has different yet crossed stories. You can choose between a spoiled "EX"-princess who was kicked out due to her being a slacker, or a doll that has lost his purpose but found it thanks to a nice lady. The story of both are good, but it needs a sequel.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky I definitely study my school work to music such as this. It works to full effect to calm me down while I'm figuring our math problems or just kick back to music while I do work on some essays. I missed playing Threads of Fate, the first time I played was on a demo at a store, then I played it with a friend whose long since moved away for no end. I just couldn't stop touching that game and playing it. I still remember I used to make sounds while attacking enemies playing it...
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky I definitely study my school work to music such as this. It works to full effect to calm me down while I'm figuring our math problems or just kick back to music while I do work on some essays. I missed playing Threads of Fate, the first time I played was on a demo at a store, then I played it with a friend whose long since moved away for no end. I just couldn't stop touching that game and playing it. I still remember I used to make sounds while attacking enemies playing it...
